heading: Abstract
text:
Learning today navigation, discernment, induction, synthesis wide body information Internet present ubiquitously every student’s fingertips.
Learning, addressing gap one’s knowledge, well established important motivator behind information-seeking activities.
Search Learning research community advocates online information search systems reconfigured become educational platforms foster learning sensemaking.
Modern search systems yet adapt support function.
important step foster learning online search identify behavioural patterns distinguish searchers gaining vs. less knowledge search.
Previous efforts primarily studied searchers short term, typically single lab session.
Many researchers expressed concern ephemeral approach, learning takes place time, fleeting.
propose exploratory longitudinal study analyze long-term searching behaviour students enrolled university course, span university semester.
research aims identify students’ searching behaviour changes time, gain new knowledge subject; processes like motivation, metacognition, self-regulation, individual differences moderate `searching learning’ behaviour.
Findings exploratory longitudinal study help build improved search systems foster human learning sensemaking, equitable face learner diversity.

heading: 1.3 Purpose of this Dissertation Proposal
text:
address gaps knowledge information searching
influences students’ learning process time, dissertation
proposal proposes conduct semester-long longitudinal study (approx.
16 weeks) university student participants. overarching research
aim identify students’ online searching behaviour correlate
learning outcomes particular university course.
Building upon principles Learning Sciences
(Ambrose et al., 2010; National Research Council, 2000; Novak, 2010; Sawyer, 2005),
empirical evidences Information Sciences
(Rieh et al., 2016; Vakkari, 2016; White, 2016a),
dissertation proposal aims tosituate students learners naturalistic contexts, 
characterized individual differences,measure students’ information search information use behaviour
time, andcorrelate information search behaviour learning
outcomes university course.Learning, addressing gap one’s knowledge, well
established important motivator behind information-seeking
activities (Section 1.1). Therefore, search systems support
rapid learning across number searchers, range tasks, can
considered effective search systems (White, 2016a, p. 310). dissertation proposal takes step direction. “
opens great expectations many-sided, great contribution 
knowledge relations search process learning outcomes”
(Bhattacharya, 2021 anonymous reviewer).

heading: 1.4 Outline
text:
dissertation proposal document structured follows. First,
principles learning relevant background domain 
Educational Sciences presented Chapter 2. Next, relevant
empirical evidences Information Searching Literature 
discussed Chapter 3. Chapter 4 presents research questions, 
overarching hypotheses, discusses rationale context 
existing research gaps. Chapter 5 describes research methods,
including longitudinal study design, experimental procedures, data
collection analyses plans, anticipated limitations, expected
schedule complete dissertation.
